newsitem.title: JAPAN: Asian meeting will not be like G7--ex-MOF official.
newsitem.headline: Asian meeting will not be like G7--ex-MOF official.

text.p: A meeting of senior financial officials from six Asia-Pacific economies next month will not function like the Group of Seven, but will be more of a forum for deep discussions, former vice finance minister Makoto Utsumi said on Tuesday.
"I don't think it will function like the G7 to discuss specific issues and so on, but is a kind of forum for more dense dialogue," Utsumi told a news conference.
Utsumi added it was important that China and the United States be included in the discussions.
Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka said earlier that Japan would host the meeting, which would also include the United States, China, Hong Kong, Australia and Singapore, on March 4.
Mitsuzuka said the major topics that would be discussed would be macro-economic issues and financial market stability, including currencies.
He added that he hoped the meeting would be held on a regular basis, and that in the future it would include finance ministers and central bankers.
